Package misc

Class Input

  • java.lang.Object
    • misc.Input
  • public class Input
extends java.lang.Object
    This class holds all methods related to the modification of user input in order to produce a specific product.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Input()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static Match[] addMatch​(Match match)
      Creates a new vector of object Match with the same values as the one in the instance of object Season with additional length, then adds the parameter match in the end of the vector.
      static void alterExistentMatch()
      Checks that there are matches registered, prints an exception if there are not or asks the user to choose a match to rewrite.
      static boolean checkString​(java.lang.String userValue)
      Checks if parameter userValue is composed by integers only.
      static void choseToImportMatches()
      Asks the user if wishes to create default matches, then asks for how many matches is desired to register, if the input is not what is expected, or if the user introduces the negation input, it returns to the data menu.
      static void deleteExistentMatch()
      Checks that there are matches registered, prints an exception if there are not or asks the user to choose a match to delete.
      static boolean matchesNotAllowed​(java.lang.String userValue)
      Checks if the first character of the parameter userValue is between 0 and 2.
      static boolean notAllowed​(java.lang.String userValue)
      Checks if the first character of the parameter userValue is between 0 and 4.
      static void saveNewMatch()
      Initializes a new object match and calls a method to add the new match to the vector of matches of the object Season.
      static boolean scoreNotAllowed​(java.lang.String userValue)
      Checks if the first character of the parameter userValue is between 0 and 6.
      static void selectMatch()
      Asks the user to choose a match to be shown and shows all the registered matches.
      static void selectPlayer()
      Asks the user to choose a match in order to show all players of each team with their names, kills, deaths and assists.
      static void showAverageAssists()
      Checks that there are matches registered, prints an exception if there are not or asks the user to choose a match to show average assists from.
      static void showAverageKills()
      Checks that there are matches registered, prints an exception if there are not or asks the user to choose a match to show average kills from.
      static void showAverageStadistics()
      Prints at the screen an average of kills, deaths, assists on all registered teams.
      static java.lang.String showMinutes​(int minute)
      Converts minutes into hours and keeps the rest of minutes.
      static void showTopAssistsMatch()
      Searches for the match with the player that has got more assists and prints it at the screen.
      static void showTopGoldMatch()
      Searches for the match with the player that has got more gold and prints it at the screen.
      static void showTopKillsMatch()
      Searches for the match with the player that has got more kills and prints it at the screen.
      static void showTopTeam()
      Shows the team and player with higher KDA registered.
      static void showTotalAssists()
      Checks that there are matches registered, prints an exception if there are not or asks the user to choose a match to show all assists from.
      static void showTotalKills()
      Checks that there are matches registered, prints an exception if there are not or asks the user to choose a match to show all kills from.
      static void showTotalMinionDamage()
      Checks that there are matches registered, prints an exception if there are not or asks the user to choose a match to show all the minion damage from.
      static void showTotalPlayerDamage()
      Checks that there are matches registered, prints an exception if there are not or asks the user to choose a match to show all the player damage from.
      static void showTotalStructureDamage()
      Checks that there are matches registered, prints an exception if there are not or asks the user to choose a match to show all the structure damage from.

      Checks if the first character of the parameter userValue is between 0 and 7.

        public Input()

    • Method Detail

      • notAllowed

        public static boolean notAllowed​(java.lang.String userValue)
        Checks if the first character of the parameter userValue is between 0 and 4.
        Parameters:
        userValue - A string without whitespaces the user previously introduced.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the first character is not between 0 and 4, returns false otherwise. Also returns true if the parameter userValue is longer than 1.

      • checkString

        public static boolean checkString​(java.lang.String userValue)
        Checks if parameter userValue is composed by integers only.
        Parameters:
        userValue - A string without whitespaces the user previously introduced.
        Returns:
        Returns false if the method finds something else than integers in the parameter userValue, returns true otherwise.

      • strictInput

        public static java.lang.String strictInput()
        Requests for user input. Also checks if the user input is the expected, it changes its behaviour if is not. If there is no input, or the input is a whitespace, waits for the next input.
        Returns:
        Returns a string without whitespaces.

      • specificDataNotAllowed

        public static boolean specificDataNotAllowed​(java.lang.String userValue)
        Checks if the first character of the parameter userValue is between 0 and 7.
        Parameters:
        userValue - A string without whitespaces the user previously introduced.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the first character is not between 0 and 7, returns false otherwise. Also returns true if the parameter userValue is longer than 1.

      • matchesNotAllowed

        public static boolean matchesNotAllowed​(java.lang.String userValue)
        Checks if the first character of the parameter userValue is between 0 and 2.
        Parameters:
        userValue - A string without whitespaces the user previously introduced.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the first character is not between 0 and 2, returns false otherwise. Also returns true if the parameter userValue is longer than 1.

      • saveNewMatch

        public static void saveNewMatch()
        Initializes a new object match and calls a method to add the new match to the vector of matches of the object Season.

      • alterExistentMatch

        public static void alterExistentMatch()
        Checks that there are matches registered, prints an exception if there are not or asks the user to choose a match to rewrite.

      • deleteExistentMatch

        public static void deleteExistentMatch()
        Checks that there are matches registered, prints an exception if there are not or asks the user to choose a match to delete.

      • showMinutes

        public static java.lang.String showMinutes​(int minute)
        Converts minutes into hours and keeps the rest of minutes.
        Parameters:
        minute - Total of minutes to convert.
        Returns:
        A String with HH:MM format where minutes have been converted to hours.

      • choseToImportMatches

        public static void choseToImportMatches()
        Asks the user if wishes to create default matches, then asks for how many matches is desired to register, if the input is not what is expected, or if the user introduces the negation input, it returns to the data menu.

      • addMatch

        public static Match[] addMatch​(Match match)
        Creates a new vector of object Match with the same values as the one in the instance of object Season with additional length, then adds the parameter match in the end of the vector. It changes its behaviour if the vector of object Match from the instance of object Season is null, and initializes it with length one.
        Parameters:
        match - Object Match that is desired to be added to the vector of object Match in the instance of object Season.
        Returns:
        A vector of object Match with the same values of the one in the instance of object Season with a new object Match added at the end.

      • selectMatch

        public static void selectMatch()
        Asks the user to choose a match to be shown and shows all the registered matches. If there is an unexpected input or if a match was shown, returns to the matches menu.

      • selectPlayer

        public static void selectPlayer()
        Asks the user to choose a match in order to show all players of each team with their names, kills, deaths and assists. If there is an unexpected input or if the players were shown, returns to the matches menu.

      • scoreNotAllowed

        public static boolean scoreNotAllowed​(java.lang.String userValue)
        Checks if the first character of the parameter userValue is between 0 and 6.
        Parameters:
        userValue - A string without whitespaces the user previously introduced.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the first character is not between 0 and 6, returns false otherwise.

      • showTopTeam

        public static void showTopTeam()
        Shows the team and player with higher KDA registered.

      • showAverageStadistics

        public static void showAverageStadistics()
        Prints at the screen an average of kills, deaths, assists on all registered teams.

      • showTopKillsMatch

        public static void showTopKillsMatch()
        Searches for the match with the player that has got more kills and prints it at the screen.

      • showTopAssistsMatch

        public static void showTopAssistsMatch()
        Searches for the match with the player that has got more assists and prints it at the screen.

      • showTopGoldMatch

        public static void showTopGoldMatch()
        Searches for the match with the player that has got more gold and prints it at the screen.

      • showTotalKills

        public static void showTotalKills()
        Checks that there are matches registered, prints an exception if there are not or asks the user to choose a match to show all kills from.

      • showTotalAssists

        public static void showTotalAssists()
        Checks that there are matches registered, prints an exception if there are not or asks the user to choose a match to show all assists from.

      • showAverageKills

        public static void showAverageKills()
        Checks that there are matches registered, prints an exception if there are not or asks the user to choose a match to show average kills from.

      • showAverageAssists

        public static void showAverageAssists()
        Checks that there are matches registered, prints an exception if there are not or asks the user to choose a match to show average assists from.

      • showTotalStructureDamage

        public static void showTotalStructureDamage()
        Checks that there are matches registered, prints an exception if there are not or asks the user to choose a match to show all the structure damage from.
